other_tests.findings: Initial visual field indicated a superior arcuate scotoma in the left eye and nasal step in the right eye.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No significant change in the size or intensity of the visual field defect was observed over 8 years.

other_tests.findings: Tilted discs were present in 75.0% (24/32) of nerves; cup-to-disc ratios ranged from 0.20 to 0.95, averaging 0.56.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No change in optic nerve appearance was observed over the follow-up period.

other_tests.findings: Grade IV open angles were revealed bilaterally.
The intraocular pressure ranged from 8 mmHg to 29 mmHg, averaging 13.5 to 17.9 mmHg.
